alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 2:24PM EST until January 08 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Calhoun and Lexington Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding begins in the Congaree National Park. This will begin to produce flooding of portions of the lower boardwalk. At 17.0 feet, The access road to the Sandy Run subdivision becomes flooded. The lower boardwalk in the Congaree National Park becomes flooded by Cedar Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 PM EST Thursday was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 8.3 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
